model_answer: The instruction given is that they should stand to begin and say “Allahu Akbar” once the Imam says it, and not to say it loudly until the Imam says it. So the correct answer would be A.

The answer is A: By saying “Assalamualaikum Warahmatullah” to the right and left; it is called Salam.

In the audio, after the prayer, the participants say "Assalamualaikum Warahmatullah" to each other as a sign of greeting and conclusion of the prayer. This phrase means "Peace be upon you and mercy of Allah." It is a common practice in Islamic prayers to say this phrase to greet each other and mark the end of the prayer.
